page.title: 06VILLAGE LIFE
page.content: The village has changed little since the turn of the century. The castle is now open to the public on Wednesday and Sunday afternoons during the summer months. Teas are served at the castle. The grounds of the castle have been skilfully planted over the years with a variety of splendid and exotic forest trees. Eastnor Park hasn't changed much in 250 years, apart from iron gates and overhead power lines. Some houses have been modernised in the village and tourists such as the caravaners in the deer park arrive for weekends and rallies. St. Mary's Children's home has become a home for the elderly. The village shop closed in March 1985 because it couldn't make enough profit. The villagers were travelling by motor car to shop elsewhere.
